comment: Not clear on topic assignments . wouldn't  recommend

For an easy class, I found myself and my classmates struggling to understand the clarity of the assignments. Cardona is often not clear on instructions for assignments which makes completing them difficult. She assigns a lot of homework. If you don't like group projects do not take this class. She would not bump up my 89. Would not take again.

She's a super sweet lady but not good at explaining projects or what is happening when. she likes group projects. After 5 absences she counts off of your grade. However, shes pretty chill about technology, and talking during class.

I passed the class so I'm content. She takes quite a bit of time to respond back to emails. She does have a number listed as well, but she's not prompt in responding to that method either. She is good with meeting up with you if need be.

Took online. LOVED. Extremely clear criteria. Very organized, easy to follow instruction. She provided multiple ways to contact her if necessary (even cell number.) 3 papers & several "essay" type assignments based on text book reading. Very easy assignments if you follow directions & read the rubrics. Highly recommend.

Her assignments can be unclear and very tedious. She often goes off subject which can be very annoying. Sometimes stuff discussed in the class has nothing to do with what is being learned. I would not take her again.
I wasn't a fan.
Cardona is wonderful! No tests, three papers. The writing topics are interesting too! Pretty easy class! Definitely taking her for 1102 next semester!!

Great professor. Organized, fair, helpful, and genuinely wants you to succeed. Readfollow the syllabus, rubrics, and assignment instructions and you should do fine. This course is designed to make you a better writer. There is a lot of work and expect to put effort into each paper. If you do, an A is attainable.

Friendly lady. Is often confusing and doesn't really answer your questions. Tends to make assignments up off the top of her head. Can be moody at times. Overall not completely awful, but I wouldn't take her again.

I took the hybrid class. She is very confusing at times. She is a little bit of a harsh grader on essays. Her essay topics can be very hard to write on. You will have to put more effort into this class that most gen ed english classes. Overall, she was fine.

Professor Cardona was very nice. She has 3 essays and many online work more towards the begining of the class. Her essay topics are very board but very easy to get an  in her class. She really wants to see everyone succeed I never bought the book and passed with a B. The online part was hard to understand.
Took this as a hybrid class. She's real good. VERY helpful. A few essays and a few quizzes. Very straightforward and simple stuff.

Talked way too much about religion.  Suggested inappropriate reading material and couldn't pronounce the books we DID read.  Was disappointed that a neo-con is espousing her beliefs at a state university.
Not very clear, and talks a lot about her own beliefs. Not the way a professor should be.

Professor Cardona is THE BEST English teacher. I attended her class over the summer, & she always tried to make the class enjoyable as possible. An A is EXTREMELY attainable. When she's explaining certain assignments, she can be confusing at times, but that is only because she wants to leave enough elbow room for you to explore the topic. TAKE HER!

While I admit Professor Cardona has grown on me over the course of the semester I don't believe I would take her again if given the chance. Extremely confusing when explaining assignments, doesn't really do a lot of teaching and she never uses the book.
Sweet awesome lady. She is very helpful and cares for her students. She works the course around her students. Take her if you get a chance to.

WHAT A SWEET WOMAN! A professor like her is RARE. TAKE HER! She's very laid back and will work with you through ANYTHING! She actually cares about her students and won't penalize your grades if "life" gets in the way. Class discussions were interesting and engaging. She's very clear in what she expects and straightforward with the assignments.

Extremely easy professor. Put forth some effort and you will at least get a B. Very flexible with grades. I had an 89 at the end of the semester and she let me rewrite a paper to get an A. Seriously, take her for any English class and you will love it.

Wonderful teacher! She really cares about us students and is very understanding and down-to-earth. If you need help with writing, she will help you out. As long as you do what is required, you can earn an A.

I don't know what people are crying about as she is the easiest professor ever! SERIOUSLY easy to get an A! You just do the work and you get an A.  The essays are so easy it is crazy.  I would take her over if I could as her class is so easy! Some students plagiarized so that is why they got a bad grade & She could have failed them all! but didn't!

She is very friendly, personable & understanding. She is very willing to change the class into what the students want to do and learn about. She is very helpful. I highly recomend her class to anyone- you won't regret it! One of the best English teachers I've ever had.

she is a great professor. very anal about grading but she is definitely helpful and understanding. go to her for any help you may need and she will help. essays are hard, but she will definitely prepare you for 1102

For a Gen Ed class, she was a bit challenging grading-wise and very vague on expectations for papers. Overall, she loves what she's doing, but sometimes doesn't communicate what is expected very well. If you enjoy English and putting forth a decent amount of effort for an A, she is a good professor to take.
Professor Cardona is really nice. She seems to care about her students' success, but grades papers very strictly. The whole class is paper after paper. She's super sweet though!

I found that the class was almost pointless. We studied the human slave trade from day 1 to the very last day. It was interesting at first but boring and continuous and we didnt study anything else. I made a B in the class. An 89, and she would not help me out ANY to get an A. I did not enjoy the class at all!

Took the class online. It was very demanding but I did learn a lot,professor Cardona is extremely helpful and will promptly respond your e-mails. She makes you review your peer assignments which in turn also helps your peer improve their paper but will help use the learned concepts. Great class but you need to be very disciplined to take it online.

She is one of the most passionate people I have ever met, however, English is not my major & I only took it because I had to so she was a bit much for me. She does motivate you & is extremely caring & willing to help you in any way possible. She is pretty scattered brain though.
She is really nice and really helpful! She lets you peer review wich is great!! If you can get than definatly try.!!

very sweet teacher, allows you to rewrite papers and get extra help. But she is scatter brained at times and often she rambles for half of the class to explain one example. the class takes a lot of time but if you do your work and ALL the writing assignments, you'll do well. no book(novel) readings in this class
easy fair sweet kind knowledgeable drops everything for her students will work with you on grading loves her job treats everyone with respect HIGHLY RECOMMENDED AS A PROFESSOR!!!

I've read all the postings about her and they have not truth.  She was so easy and helpful that I would take her class all over again.  I hope she teaches a higher class so I can take her again! Anyone if you can take her get the class!  This semester students plagiarized but she tried to work with them as much as KSU allowed! She is very sweet!!!!

She is extremely helpful and amazing.  We really only did one paper in class.  It was a 5-7 page paper but it wasn't bad.  The papers I have done in other classes have been atrocious.  She is not any where near hard.  All the angry words about her really have no basis.  She is amazin and will do everything in her power to help!  Her class fill fast

I rarely learned anything English related. I learned more about her personal life instead. That 30 page research paper turned into an 8 page paper instead. Scored an A. My advice, kiss up to her and just coast your way through.

Can be a bit scatter brained at times, but she is a very easy grader. Just slop something down on paper and you will atleat get a C. She is always willing to help when you ask her. Her directions are unclear at times, but like I mentioned before, she is a very easy grader, so it really dosent matter.

Amazing prof will help you with any and all problems is the nicest prof I ever met and even when we had problems on a paper canceled the paper She'll go out of her way to help you She would help a fly if it could be helped She does tell stories but they illustrate a point She loves teaching and is an easy A. DROP EVERYTHING TO GET HER she is amazin

I would say DROP EVERYTHING TO GET THIS PROFESSOR!!! She'll work with you in any way you can.  I guess those who think she's scatterbrained or off on tangents don't understand what a good professor needs to be about.  She tells stories to explain concepts.  She is the nicest professor I've encountered and is so lenient on grading.  She's an easy A!
She was very fair in her grading and was very helpful if you did not understand what she was talking about.  Her papers are kind of fun and interesting.
Very fair

This professor was quite scatter minded. I wouldnt take her again if I could help it. Although the class work seemed mundane, she was horrible at giving direction and never really set in stone what she wanted. Unclear class and didnt have alot to do with english. If you like hearing about her personal life, you will do great.

Loves to NOT talk about English but her personal life. Only wrote a less than 15 pg. research paper and scored a B in the class. EASIEST class yet be prepared to be bored with the most pointless conversations.

Good teacher. If your really interested in English, you might find 95 % of class a waste of time. Although, she did make writing a 20 page research paper easy. She grades fair, and as long as you do the work and show up for class, there is no reason anyone shouldn't make an A

if you like theology then take the class. we never did anything that was related to the paper. you only write one paper the whole semester around 15pgs. there is a Final over the book which is hardly ever opened. all in all I wouldn't take her was a waste of my time

Well, there is only one project due, but don't expect any clear instruction or help on how to do it.  This teacher is totally off topic and impossible to follow.  Trying to get any information from her elicited a "you're doing great, just keep doing what you're doing!"  Okay, well I was totally lost and now I'm just saying forget it.
Professor Cardona is very fair in her grading.  She expects students to 'show up on time, ready to play.'  I enjoyed her class overall.
Mrs. Cardona is a great teacher. Easy A if you do the work and come to class. Very friendly and personable. Not bad to look at either.

Alot of people mistake her broad teaching methods for disorganization. She wants you to discover the world for yourself. Theres no ONE way to complete your assignments in her class, She wants you to do it on your own. Shes a good teacher, and probably the only one who understands how kids really should be taught. Apply yourself a little and u = A+.
Easy class.  Just show up, kiss up to her, laugh at all her lame jokes and do good on essays.  I fel tlike I was taking a middle school english class.  And don't plan on getting out of class on time.

I got a good grade but it wasn't even worth it. This was the most disorganized class I've ever been in - I feel like she was using us to advertise for Greek Study Abroad and her friend's play. She's extremely sweet but I get the feeling that English isn't her forte. If you like to write and be challenged, don't take. Easy A, though.

I was very confused during most of the class. People say that she is better teaching 1101. She is sometimes off-the-wall. Some days you can walk into class and there will be something due that you may have heard of only once during class. She is difficult to comprehend. But, she is a nice person.

Cardona is an amazing professor who may be ambiguous for a short while, but won't penalize if it was her error.  Gives room for students to explore their own interests (web design, research, study abroad, etc.) while still strengthening their English skills.
Really cool teacher.  Very understanding and wants all her students to do good.  She's very entertaining too.    my favorite prof. at kennesaw

She is so inredibly sweet. She cares about more than just how her students perform in her class, and encouraged us all in life. Very caring. It's nice to have a professor that gets to know her students. Class wasn't that hard to me (but English is my strong point). We didn't really write THAT many papers. I definitely want to take her class again.
I choose this prof. after reading all the good comments about her. Well, I liked her enough. She was pretty laid back. But she definatly had her favorite students from day one and I didn't like that.

Very caring and helpful, easy going schedule and interesting topics. I'm a CSIS major but I enjoyed her class. I got an A and I'm no writer. Took another instructor for 1102 but had to drop it because they were terrible. Will try and get Cardona again in the future.
No Comments
Best teacher ever. You would be stupid to not take her for both your English classes.
besides the fact that I couldn't help being mesmerized by her beauty, I enjoyed her class
Great person, very clear, easy to understand, easy writing, oh yah HOT
SUCH AN AWESOME TEACHER! HELPS AND CARES FOR HER STUDENTS! CAN'T WAIT TO TAKE MORE OF HER CLASSES!
AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME professor!! Very passionate about teaching! Outstanding way out getting her point across!
Amazing teacher! Like to build a bond with her class. She is extremely nice.

Great teacher. She gives assignements that deal with real life...like writing a resume. She treates the class with respect and is always on time and available to help out. Uses the class time to work on group projects...that helps a lot!
She often went off on tangents but overall was a very nice and she graded the papers very leniently.  This was an easy class to pass.
